author: draganrakita
content: Small nit on https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7516 should we maybe rename BLOBBASEFEE to BLOBFEE, seems nicer imo?

author: dapplion
content: ePBS is a much more popular term that would attract more participation IMO

author: timbeiko
content: Part of the reason to _not_ name it #PBS or #MEV in the past was the risk of attracting too many people ðŸ˜…  That said, if you all feel it's better to do rename, I'm not super opposed.

author: gakonst
content: Seems like Geth also calls it that, we'd be up for putting a PR on the EIP if ppl are supportive

author: timbeiko
content: Not a very strong opinon, but `BLOBFEE` sounds too me like the total fee for the blob, rather than the gas price to submit it (the result of `calc_data_fee` rather than `get_blob_gasprice`).

author: draganrakita
content: While you have mentioned it, maybe `BLOBPRICE` is more accurate to use

author: lightclient
content: `BLOBPRICE` might be the best way to go, but it is important to note that although the semantics are the exact same, if we ever add priority to blob gas then it will result in a different value than the current proposal -> will be "effective blob gas price" instead of "blob gas base fee"

author: lightclient
content: at this moment they are the exact same

author: lightclient
content: the way rollups want to use this though it seems what they actually want _is_ `BLOBPRICE`, or maybe slightly more accurate `BLOBGASPRICE`

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> I think `BLOBBASEFEE` is correct. Yes, we do not have the priority fee explicitly exposed for the blobs, but that doesn't mean there isn't a priority fee. It is just that it's paid via the "regular" priority fee or tip. It is actually likely that proposers would want to see a higher tip for including blobs, because they increase the risk of their blocks being orphaned, which the tip has to compensate for

author: lightclient
content:
I mean either would be correct today. Itâ€™s more a question of how would the instruction behave in the future _if_ there was a priority for blob gas. That may never exist, but we should probably be clear on what the value weâ€™re returning here is. Is it in relation to executing tx or to the chain itself.

After saying `BLOBGASPRICE` was better, I think I might be wrong bc a rollup might then be able to grief users in a trustless system by paying a large priority fee and mining the block themselves. So I change my stance again to `BLOBBASEFEE` ðŸ˜¬

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> As I said, just because there is no *explicit* priority fees for blobs in protocol, there is still a priority fee, it will just be included in the normal tip.

author: lightclient
content: Yeah i'm not saying there isn't an implicit priority fee, I'm just saying for the semantics of `BLOBGASPRICE` vs. `BLOBBASEFEE` there is no priority fee explicitly in the blob dimension to cause the values to differ.

author: draganrakita
content: That would be my point to, we do not have the priority fee exposed for the blobs, so calling it blobbasefee feels inaccurate. Blob transaction as any transaction use different mechanism not related to blob fee to prioritise itself and they pay an additional price per blob to be included. Naming is always hard and it depends on preferences and stances, would prefer `BLOBGASPRICE` but am fine with `BLOBBASEFEE`.

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> But it is a basefee. It does not measure the actual price the user paid to get the blob included (because they can pay an arbitrary tip using the transaction priority fee and even out of protocol mechanisms, and these are necessary with or without congestion (to compensate the proposer for orphan risk)). The tip/priority fee is also not exposed in the EVM at the moment, and it's still called `BASEFEE`

author: lightclient
content: the tip is currently exposed by subtracting `BASEFEE` from `GASPRICE`

author: bridge-bot
content:
<dankrad> Which is only accurate if there was no side channel payment. And side channel payments are even possible in protocol (by sending another higher tip TX from the same account).

In the case of blobs, there is always a "side channel" tip (through the normal tip)

author: draganrakita
content: I think i am getting what you are saying, as priority fee can be used to create "sub" market (priority queue inside priority queue) of transaction that want blob to be included.
